author: The Frontier Post
title: Fire at Lahore's Hafeez Center extinguished
text:
F.P. Report
LAHORE: A major tragedy was narrowly avoided at Lahore‚Äôs well-known commercial hub, Hafeez Center, after a fire broke out due to a short circuit on Thursday.
The fire was brought under control within 20 minutes, saving the building and its businesses from massive losses.
The quick response prevented the situation from getting out of hand.
Chief Minister Punjab Maryam Nawaz Sharif praised the prompt efforts of the rescue team, calling it a ‚Äújob well done.‚Äù
She also directed a complete security and safety audit of the entire Hafeez Center building to avoid similar incidents in the future.
Traders and members of the business community breathed a sigh of relief and expressed gratitude to the Punjab government and Rescue 1122 for stepping in just in the nick of time.
They said that if help hadn‚Äôt come so quickly, they would have suffered losses worth millions of rupees.
According to eyewitnesses, the fire broke out suddenly due to a short circuit, but the Rescue 1122 team was quick on their feet and sprang into action.
Their timely intervention helped nip the problem in the bud.
Shopkeepers at Hafeez Center said the fire could have turned the entire market into ashes had it not been for the brave and rapid efforts of the rescue workers.
The incident has once again raised concerns about fire safety in commercial buildings, prompting authorities to crack down on negligence and push for stricter safety standards.

author: IsraelEstadoGenocida
title: #43 Rabino sionista expone la mentalidad supremacista sionista autoproclam√°ndose como los "elegidos de dios" y admitiendo sentirse superior a los no-judios
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
[#3](c3#c-3) y est√° escrito, en su libro m√°gico, que todos los no jud√≠os existen para servir a los jud√≠os.
Su libro m√°gico es el bueno, los dem√°s libros m√°gicos no.
[#19](c19#c-19) En realidad s√≠, pero no te alarmes, no hay construcci√≥n de la identidad etnica de un grupo (y m√°s si se trata de uno generalmente minoritario y perseguido)n sin su dosis de etnocentrismo.
En el caso de los creyentes en yahv√© el resto de la humanidad es referida como ‚Äúgoyim‚Äù, o ‚Äúgentiles‚Äù y no tiene connotaciones especialmente positivas.
[#3](c3#c-3) T√≠pico de fanatismos y sectas cuando se hace una barrera entre los que est√°n dentro y los que est√°n fuera. Cuando la religi√≥n no respeta otras formas de ver el mundo es cuando empiezan los fanatismos y las hostias. Si no se acepta la diversidad de credos, apaga y v√°monos porque lo que viene luego no es agradable para nadie.
Luego empezar√°n con sus Frentes Populares de Judea y acabar√°n a hostia limpia entre ellos, porque alguien que necesita y busca enemigos para elevar su moral y sus creencias son un saco de hostias en potencia. Alguien que piense as√≠, tiene todas las papeletas para recibir hostias a cascoporro y es lo que van buscando. Quien anda con fuego acaba quem√°ndose.
[#5](c5#c-5) En realidad este discurso en concreto se parece m√°s al del ISIS que al de Hitler.
Aunque el resultado de ambos sea el mismo.
[#9](c9#c-9) Creo que el problema es que eso lo dice la religi√≥n de los jud√≠os, que son descendientes de no s√© qu√© tribu elegida por un dios.
Y habr√° jud√≠os que se tomen el judaismo como pertenencia a un grupo y lo reinterpretan y lo ponen al servicio de su vida (igual que hay cristianos que no apedrean a su hija si se casa sin el permiso de su padre). Pero el judaismo tiene una base de supremacismo muy mala de esquivar.
[#2](c2#c-2) Un mes.. da un mes, al resto del planeta - sin eeuu... iban a ver los "elegidos" que opinan de aquello del "pueblo elegido"...
Pues para ser el pueblo elegido:
- menuda mierda territorio les ha dado, a m√≠ que me den algo que no sea un puto desierto: Francia, El norte de Espa√±a, Italia, las Seychelles, las mismas orillas del Nilo, Mesopotamia. Zonas f√©rtiles.
- Salvo los √∫ltimos 70 a√±os les han dado m√°s que a una estera.
As√≠ que menudo dios cutre.
[#11](c11#c-11) Eso es: si su dios los hubiera elegido y les tuviera cari√±o bien pudo haberles dao cuerpo de senegal√©s...
[#11](c11#c-11) Un amigo ingeniero agr√≥nomo me cont√≥ que aquella zona en tiempos b√≠blicos fue un vergel, pero empezaron a regar los cultivos con agua de mar y se lo cargaron. No son muy listos los ‚Äúelegidos‚Äù.
Si Dios existiera har√≠a un fisting con su culo y les enviar√≠a al puto infierno por toda la eternidad.
[#23](c23#c-23) No s√© salvaron los que no quisieron realizar la Ali√° (que empez√≥ en 1840 https://es.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ali%C3%A1 ) y a esos que no se salvaron los llamaron los sacrificados o holocausto https://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Holocausto_(sacrificio)
Es supremacista (pueblo elegido, el resto est√° para servir) y elitista (no buscan crear nuevos adeptos como en el cristianismo o islamismo o naces jud√≠o o no eres jud√≠o)
Esto lo dicen los lideres religiosos judios y la mayoria de ellos lo aceptan como algo natural y te lo repiten con otras palabras menos extremas pero que vienen a ser lo mismo
Pues al final hablando as√≠ hasta hacen buenos a los nazis, igual estaban enga√±ados con esta gente...

author: Christine D√∂ssel
title: Claus Peymann, der letzte K√∂nig des Theaters: ein Nachruf
text: Claus Peymann tot? Damit ist nun wirklich der letzte K√∂nig des Theaters abgetreten, und es wird kein solcher mehr nachkommen, so viel ist gewiss. Die Zeit der Patriarchen, sie scheint gerade vorbeizugehen. Zumindest im Theater , wo Peymann als Regisseur und Intendant ihr vorderster und lautester Vertreter war: der F√ºr- und Gro√üsprecher der Zunft, ihr Anwalt, Vortr√§umer und Aufmischer. Als Provokateur so ber√ºhmt wie ber√ºchtigt, so gesch√§tzt wie gef√ºrchtet. Auch geliebt. Eine Legende schon zu Lebzeiten, dessen war er sich bewusst. Immer bereit f√ºr eine Attacke. Immer gut f√ºr einen Skandal.

author: John C. Derrick
title: Best Gardens To Visit and See on Each of the Hawaiian Islands
text:
The Hawaiian Islands are home to some of the worlds most beautiful gardens, arboretums, and landscapes. Below we've included links to several of the best gardens on the islands, most of which require admission, but at a price worth paying.
On the list of gardens below, we've included the admission price when possible, a rank (out of 5 stars), general location, and included any additional information as necessary. If you discover a garden we've mistakenly left off this list, by all means please contact us and we'll make sure it's added.
KAUAI GARDENS
Limahuli Garden----Admission: starting at $25-30/adult | Location: North Kauai | Rating: National Tropical Botanical Garden----Admission: $35/adult (Allerton), $20/adult (McBryde) | Location: South Kauai | Rating: Smith's Tropical Paradise----Admission: $6/adult | Location: East Kauai | Rating: Na Aina Kai Botanical Garden----Admission: starting at $20/adult | Location: Northeast Kauai | Rating:

Includes the top must-see & do attractions, best times to visit, a monthly weather & visitor summary, and our tips on how to save when booking your car rental, tours, and activities. Plus, grab our free Hawaii Summary Guidesheets. Check out our
2025 Hawaii Visitor Guides.
MAUI GARDENS
Garden of Eden Botanical Arboretum----Admission: $20/adult | Location: Northeast Coast | Rating: Ke'anae Arboretum----Admission: $Free | Location: Northeast Coast | Rating: Kula Botanical Gardens----Admission: $15/adult | Location: Upcountry | Rating:
BIG ISLAND GARDENS
Lili'uokalani Park and Gardens----Admission: $Free | Location: Downtown Hilo | Rating: Hawaii Tropical Botanical Garden----Admission: $30/adult | Location: Hamakua Coast | Rating: Umauma Experience----Admission: $12/adult | Location: Hamakua Coast | Rating:
OAHU GARDENS
Foster Botanical Garden----Admission: $5/adult | Location: Honolulu | Rating: Ho‚Äôomaluhia Botanical Garden----Admission: $Free | Location: Kaneohe - East Coast | Rating: Waimea Valley Botanical Garden----Admission: $25/adult | Location: Haleiwa - North Shore | Rating:
- Koko Crater Botanical Garden ----Admission: $Free | Location: Honolulu | Rating:
- Lili ªuokalani Botanical Garden ----Admission: $Free | Location: Honolulu | Rating:

author: mdillard
title: God Calls Bonura Family To Adopt Five Siblings From Foster Care
text:
Comfort
Family Adopts Five Siblings From Foster Care: ‚ÄúGod Made a Way and Love Made It Possible!‚Äù
Read the inspiring story of how faith lead one family to grow x 5!
Andi Bonura‚Äôs hands trembled as she picked up the phone one night in 2017. It‚Äôs happening. It‚Äôs really happening! she thought, her mind a whirl of excitement as her caseworker greeted her.
When Andi and her husband, Thomas, got married, they were sure of two things: They wanted a large family and they wanted to be foster parents. Having their own children proved to be a difficult battle. But, finally, Andi gave birth to three beautiful babies ‚Äî Joey, now 11, Sadie, 10, and Daphne, 8. Watching them grow was Andi and Thomas‚Äô greatest joy, and it only bolstered their desire to become foster parents.
Now after a long approval process and unbridled anticipation‚Ä¶
‚ÄúAndi, we have a little baby here at the hospital,‚Äù their caseworker said, a smile in her voice. ‚ÄúCan you come pick him up?‚Äù
‚ÄúI‚Äôm on the way!‚Äù Andi replied, racing out the door.
The whole family instantly fell in love with baby Bryson. So much so that Andi found herself wanting to know more about him, and two months after taking him in, Andi asked her caseworker for more information.
‚ÄúHe actually has four other siblings,‚Äù the foster coordinator explained. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre all placed in different homes.‚Äù
Five siblings and none of them together? Andi thought, her heart breaking. I wish we could do something to help. And all at once, Andi knew in her heart what she had to do.
MUST-READ:
Grammy-nominated Musician With Missing Fingers Adopts Boy With Same Birth Defect: ‚ÄúIt Was All God‚Äôs Plan!‚Äù
A heartwarming reunion
‚ÄúWhat can we do to get them all?‚Äù Andi asked.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry‚Ä¶‚Äù the caseworker said, explaining that the foster system allowed for only six children total to live in a home, making it impossible for the Bonura family to foster all four of Bryson‚Äôs siblings.
‚ÄúCan we at least get two more of them?‚Äù Andi asked.
‚ÄúMaybe,‚Äù the caseworker hedged. ‚ÄúLet me look into this and see what we can do.‚Äù After months of petitioning to reunite the siblings, the Bonuras were eventually able to welcome David, 6, and Gabi, 4, into their home. Seeing the siblings together, Andi‚Äôs heart swelled, but she knew something was still missing.
I wish we could reunite the whole family, she mused, praying for the chance to do so. And in August of 2018, the Bonuras got their wish when a new regulation passed, allowing a foster home to have more than six children ‚Äî as long as the foster children were blood siblings.
‚ÄúFinally!‚Äù Andi and Thomas rejoiced when they heard the news. ‚ÄúWe can reunite Bryson with his 8-year-old twin brothers, Thomas and Carter!‚Äù
Soon, they were all under one roof ‚Äî a miracle no one thought could be topped, until they received yet another phone call.
MUST READ:
Star Lineman Jason Brown Quits NFL And Starts A Farm To Feed The Hungry: ‚ÄúGod Laid It On My Heart!‚Äù
A forever family
‚ÄúThe court has decided to terminate the parents‚Äô rights,‚Äù the caseworker told the Bonuras. ‚ÄúThey are all up for adoption!‚Äù
Andi could hardly believe her ears when the caseworker followed with the question she had already answered in her heart long ago. ‚ÄúWould you like to adopt all five?‚Äù
‚ÄúYes!‚Äù she and Thomas exclaimed, happy tears cascading down their faces. And after the grueling two-year-long process, the adoption was finalized through a Zoom call during the height of the COVID-19 outbreak May of 2020 ‚Äî complete with a drive-by parade with neighbors and friends.
And the miracles didn‚Äôt stop there. As the Bonura family shared photos online of their happy family on adoption day, they began hearing from others about how they had been inspired by their story and the trust they‚Äôve had in God all along.
Strangers and friends alike flooded the Bonuras‚Äô social media pages to tell them how moved they were by what they had done for the children. I had a miscarriage, but I‚Äôve now decided to foster and adopt! explained one stranger in a message. But the sweetest message came from Andi‚Äôs old college friend. I have been thinking about fostering or adopting, she wrote. And your story inspired me to move forward with it!
The Bonuras never imagined that their dream of being foster parents would not only allow them the opportunity to make their family whole ‚Äî but also to inspire others. But today, each message of support and love warms the family‚Äôs hearts and has grown their faith.
‚ÄúI had a lot of fears, but this was God‚Äôs plan for us. God made a way,‚Äù Andi smiles. ‚ÄúI realized God had faith in me, so I needed to have faith in me too. When we got married 15 years ago, we never imagined a house with eight kids, but it‚Äôs an amazing blessing we have with these precious children. Now, we can‚Äôt imagine them ever not being part of the family ‚Äî we are so grateful every day!‚Äù
For
more comforting stories about God‚Äôs plan, keep reading‚Ä¶ Savannah Guthrie Shares Her Faith Journey: ‚ÄúGod Doesn‚Äôt Cause Pain, He Carries Us Through It‚Äù (EXCLUSIVE) Grieving Daughter Receives Inspiration From Heaven: ‚ÄúThe Words Just Kept Coming!‚Äù Olympic Hopeful Has Near-Death Experience That Teaches Her ‚ÄúGod Has A Plan For Us All‚Äù

author: @indianexpress
title: Meta knew it used pirated books to train AI, authors say
text:
Meta knew it used pirated books to train AI, authors say The authors sued Meta in 2023, arguing that the tech giant misused their books to train its large language model Llama. By: Reuters New Delhi | January 10, 2025 09:27 IST 2 min read Meta AI Studio is currently limited to the United States. (Image Source: Reuters) Meta Platforms used pirated versions of copyrighted books to train its artificial intelligence systems with approval from its CEO Mark Zuckerberg, a group of authors alleged in newly disclosed court papers.
Ta-Nehisi Coates, comedian Sarah Silverman and other authors suing Meta for copyright infringement made the accusations in filings made public on Wednesday in California federal court. They said internal documents produced by Meta during the discovery process showed the company knew the works were pirated.
Spokespeople for Meta did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
Advertisement The authors sued Meta in 2023, arguing that the tech giant misused their books to train its large language model Llama.
The case is one of several alleging that copyrighted works by authors, artists and others were used to develop AI products without permission. Defendants have argued that they made fair use of copyrighted material.
The authors asked the court on Wednesday for permission to file an updated complaint. They said new evidence showed Meta used the AI training dataset LibGen, which allegedly includes millions of pirated works, and distributed it through peer-to-peer torrents.
They said internal Meta communications showed Zuckerberg ‚Äúapproved Meta‚Äôs use of the LibGen dataset notwithstanding concerns within Meta‚Äôs AI executive team (and others at Meta) that LibGen is ‚Äòa dataset we know to be pirated.'‚Äù
Advertisement U.S. District Judge Vince Chhabria last year dismissed claims that text generated by Meta‚Äôs chatbots infringed the authors‚Äô copyrights and that Meta unlawfully stripped their books‚Äô copyright management information (CMI).
The writers argued Wednesday that the evidence bolstered their infringement claims and justified reviving their CMI claim and adding a new computer fraud claim.
Chhabria said during a hearing on Thursday that he would allow the writers to file an amended complaint but expressed skepticism about the merits of the fraud and CMI claims.

} .short_in_wrap { margin:10px 20px 0;box-shadow: none;} .short_article_img { width: 100%;} .home_short_heading{ padding: 10px 15px; } .home_shorts_detailing{font-size: 12px; padding: 10px 15px;} .home_shorts_btm_effects:before{ width: 83%;left: 30px;} .home_shorts_btm_effects:after{ width: 78%;left: 28px;} .home_view_shorts { bottom: 20px; color: #fff; font-weight: 700; } .home_view_shorts a:after{border: solid #fff;border-width: 0 2px 2px 0;} .home_shorts_article_summery{ margin: 5px 15px 20px; -webkit-line-clamp: 5;} .ie-network-fe .double-border.shorts_home_widget{margin-left: -20px;margin-right: -20px;} .ie-network-fe .home_view_shorts a{color: inherit;} } /* FE shorts */ .fe-homepage-shorts{display: flex;column-gap: 20px;width: 100%;margin: 0;} .shorts_home_widget.fe-homepage-shorts{background-color:#0b122b;} .FE-shorts-main{background-color:#0b122b;} .home_more_shorts{text-align: center;margin: 10px auto;color: #fff;padding-bottom: 20px;} .FE-shorts-main .short_in_wrap{box-shadow: none;} .ie-network-fe .shorts_home_header{height: 40px;} .ie-network-fe .home_article_section a{color: #dc0505;} .ie-network-loksatta .home_shorts_article_summery,.ie-network-jansatta .home_shorts_article_summery,.ie-network-jansatta .home_short_heading,.ie-network-loksatta .home_short_heading{font-family: inherit;} .ie-network-loksatta .home_short_heading {font-size: 16px;line-height: 21px;} .ie-network-fe.home .home_short_heading{padding-top: 0;} .ie-network-fe .home_short_heading{font-family: var(--wp--custom--font-main);} .ie-network-fe .home_shorts_article_summery{font-family: var(--wp--custom--font-main);font-size: 13px; line-height: 21px;} /* JS shorts */ @media screen and (min-width: 768px) { .js-shorts_home_widget .shorts_home_widget{background: transparent;margin-bottom: 10px;padding-bottom: 60px;padding-top: 14px;} .js-shorts_home_widget .shorts_home_widget:before,.js-shorts_home_widget .shorts_home_widget::after{content: none;} .js-shorts_home_widget{background-color: #0a112d;border-radius: 10px;} .js-shorts_home_widget .home_shorts_article_summery{-webkit-line-clamp:3} .js-shorts_home_widget .home_view_shorts{bottom:10px;} .js-shorts_home_widget .home_view_shorts a{color: #fff;} .js-shorts_home_widget .home_view_shorts a::after{bottom: -2px;} .js-shorts_home_widget .home_shorts_detailing{padding: 0 15px;} .js-shorts_home_widget .home_short_heading{padding-top: 5px;} .js-shorts_home_widget .short_article_img{margin-bottom: 0;} .ie-network-jansatta .shorts_home_widget .home_view_shorts a{color: #000;} .js-shorts_home_widget .shorts_home_widget .home_view_shorts a{color: #fff;} } .ie-network-jansatta .home_view_shorts a::after{background-image: url("/wp-content/themes/ie-network-theme/assets/build/css/../src/img/arrow.svg");transform: none;padding: 5px;margin-left: 7px;padding-right: 13px;background-repeat: no-repeat;border: none;bottom:-1px;} .shorts_home_header a img{margin: auto;} @media screen and (max-width:767px) { .js-shorts_home_widget .home_view_shorts a{color: #fff;} .js-shorts_home_widget .home_view_shorts a::after{bottom: -1px;} } /*

author: @TheDailyGuardian
title: Meet The 56-Year-Old Woman With The Body Of A 37-Year-Old
text:
[+](javascipt:void(0);)
Julie Gibson Clark from Phoenix, Arizona, is making waves in the biohacking community. At 56, she boasts a biological age of just 37, slowing her ageing process by 34%. Her efforts have earned her the second spot in the Rejuvenation Olympics, a platform that tracks global longevity enthusiasts.
üß¨ Bryan Johnson spends millions on anti-aging, but you don‚Äôt have to!
Discover how .
[@julsg50]hacks longevity on a budget.Read more here:
[https://t.co/k4EBJHS08M][#FrugalLongevity][#LongevityHacks][#Longevity][#HealthyAging][#JulieGibsonClark][pic.twitter.com/LmA53RZKZg]‚Äî Longevity (@longevitymag)
[August 12, 2024]
Clark‚Äôs journey has even outpaced Bryan Johnson, who ranks sixth despite spending $2 million annually on anti-ageing methods. In contrast, Clark‚Äôs routine costs a mere $12 a day, proving that longevity doesn‚Äôt have to break the bank.
Clark‚Äôs reverse-ageing routine is a testament to discipline and balance:
Morning Ritual (5 AM)
‚Äì Green tea, meditation, and mindful reading set a positive tone.
Workout (7 AM)
‚Äì Seasonal exercises, including cardio, stretching, and sauna sessions, paired with morning light exposure.
Nutritious Meals
‚Äì 9 AM: A green smoothie with nutrient-rich ingredients.
‚Äì 11 AM: A veggie bowl with protein, aiming for 1 pound of vegetables daily.
Midday Wellness
‚Äì 10 AM: A ‚Äúgreens latte‚Äù made from bone broth and leafy greens.
‚Äì 1 PM: A 20-minute session of Transcendental Meditation for mental clarity.
Evening Wind-Down
‚Äì 5 PM: Family time over a healthy dinner.
‚Äì 7:30 PM: A relaxing walk to clear her mind.
‚Äì 9 PM: Early bedtime for optimal sleep.
Clark emphasizes the importance of consistency while allowing for flexibility, especially during weekends. She avoids coffee due to sensitivity and prioritizes relaxation, mindfulness, and quality sleep. Her philosophy? Longevity is a long-term game, not about perfection but persistence.
Julie Gibson Clark‚Äôs inspiring reverse-ageing journey demonstrates that with the right mindset and daily habits, anyone can take charge of their biological clock. Her affordable and sustainable approach to longevity offers hope and inspiration to those seeking to age gracefully.
